results.title: Muscular system [color]
results.brief_description: This film looks at the three types of muscle in the human musculature system. The structure of the muscle, the nerve impulse and the chemical process of muscular movement are explained.

results.title: Muscles and bones of the body
results.brief_description: The importance of the muscles and bones to the internal and external functioning of the human body. How tendons, joints, muscles and the bones of the skeleton work smoothly together as one unit. The difference between voluntary and involuntary muscles and the importance of proper exercise and diet to a healthy body.

results.title: Muscle beach
results.creator_credit: I Lerner, J Strick and Strick Film Company
results.brief_description: A humorous and poetic impression of the pursuit of physical culture on the San Monica Beach, California. The languor’s of a summer afternoon are contrasted satirically with the fervours of the body builders and devotees of physical exercise.

results.title: Muscle
results.creator_credit: Barry Lank, Andreas Poulsson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Pat Feras, who is a social worker by profession, spends most of her leisure hours body building. This film shows Pat training for, and competing in, a women’s body building championship and includes fascinating footage, of the championship, both from backstage and upfront.

results.title: Murrayville Consolidated School
results.creator_credit: E.J. Perry and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Documentary about a co-educational school in Murrayville, Victoria which began as a single room class in 1914 to a consolidated school by 1946. Children from about a dozen areas including Manya North, Kadoon, Gunamalary, Ngallo Sunset etc were picked up by bus from their rural homes.

results.title: Murray River trip per 'Marion' July 1940
results.brief_description: Home movie of trip taken along the Murray River in July 1940 showing picturesque sights along the journey including the almond blossoms and oranges at Berri, South Australia; the junction of the Murray and Darling Rivers near Wentworth; the many lochs between Mildura to Morgan; paddle-steamers and a sunset on the Murray.

results.title: Murray River salination
results.brief_description: This film begins by showing the building of the Dartmouth Dam on the Mitta Mitta River to flush out the Murray River whose river basin is comparable to the Danube Basin, but has only 17% of the Danube’s flow. It shows the devastating impact of ever-increasing salinity in the Murray River on the agricultural productivity and the purity of Adelaide’s domestic water supply. Suggests ways of overcoming the salinity problem through saline interception schemes, such as those pioneered by the NSW government. A valuable insight to the political nature of the great Muray River by its custodians, Victoria, South Australia and New South Wales. Suitable for upper secondary level.
